Articles.Content: I have only MechJeb2 in my game data for my only mod, I have the folder in GameData along with the squad folder, but when I get in game the MechJeb2 items do not show up. I've tried validating the game files, reinstalling the game a couple times. When I get in-game it says nothing of my files being in the wrong place, yet it still doesn't work, Help?
Are you sure you unzipped the folder? Also make sure that you don't have GameData/Mechjeb2/Gamedata/Mechjeb2.
I extracted the file directly into the game data file, and I didn't use CKAN. I downloaded it manually, and I just re-checked the files, and there is no separate game data file

If you are playing in Science or Career mode, the MechJeb items don't show up right away - they need to be "purchased".  If you are playing in Sandbox mode, the MechJeb box shows up under the 'command and control' (I think) tab.  If it's not there, try checking your anti-virus and/or firewall.  My AV every so often will delete a .dll that doesn't cause the KSP load to fail, but whatever mod had the .dll deleted stops working...

ZD

17 minutes ago, ZuluDoggy said:

If you are playing in Science or Career mode, the MechJeb items don't show up right away - they need to be "purchased".  If you are playing in Sandbox mode, the MechJeb box shows up under the 'command and control' (I think) tab.  If it's not there, try checking your anti-virus and/or firewall.  My AV every so often will delete a .dll that doesn't cause the KSP load to fail, but whatever mod had the .dll deleted stops working...

ZD

I didn't see the Item in sandbox after rifling through the items there, and I checked the firewall and KSP, and KSP navigator are both allowed by windows firewall, so I'm not sure if that is the problem. I checked my anti-virus software and I don't see any recent removals from them
Assuming you're running windows, try running the ksp_64.exe as admin. At some point I had problems with loading mods caused by not running in admin mode.

2 minutes ago, Jas0n said:

Assuming you're running windows, try running the ksp_64.exe as admin. At some point I had problems with loading mods caused by not running in admin mode.

Just tried that, no luck
WHAT IN GODS NAME ITS HERE NOW THANKS FOR TRYING TO HELP BUT IT FIXED ITSELF I GUESS
